title: DoD Ends Re-Enlistment Bonus for Some

content: There are many who aren't getting bonuses. Shipboard engineers used to get hazardous duty pay, and their reenlistment bonuses used to be rather high. They now receive very little. Fact is, it happens all throughout the services. The bonus should not really be the main deciding factor of reenlistment. It should be service of country that comes first. Everyone is different though.

content: I agree and as he is career military with almost 18 years this is not the reason he will reenlist, but he has NEVER received a bonus ever, oh one but we had to re-pay it when he took the FT AGR position. It would just be nice to be treated fairly. If one area gets a bonus all should, at least one for moral purposes. What my solider or the technicians do is no less imporatant then any other service member. I just get so tired hearing how happy he should be to be in the AGR program...I am still supporting a solider who has deployed multiple times just like any non-AGR soldier.
